Tripiá¹­aka master Saá¹ƒghadeva of KaÅ›mÄ«ra during the Fu Qin dynasty

The small seven and the great seven, inclusion, hook and chain, existence, by what samÄdhi one cuts off the fetters, the knowledge of the eight kinds of people who have eliminated the defilements through the various paths.
There are nine fetters:
The fetters of craving, hatred, pride, ignorance, views, false resolve, doubt, stinginess, and jealousy.
If the fetters of craving bind one's body, does one have hatred?
If the fetters of hatred bind one, do the fetters of craving also bind one?
If the fetters of craving bind one's body, do the fetters of pride, ignorance, views, false resolve, doubt, stinginess, and jealousy also bind one?
If the fetters of jealousy bind one, do the fetters of craving also bind one?
Up to if the fetters of stinginess bind one's body, do the fetters of jealousy also bind one?ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
If there is the fetter of jealousy, is there also the fetter of stinginess?
If in a person's body the past fetter of craving binds, does the future [fetter of craving] also exist?
If the future [fetter of craving] exists, does the past [fetter of craving] also exist?ğŸ”½If the past [fetter of craving] exists, does the present [fetter of craving] also exist?
If the present [fetter of craving] exists, does the past [fetter of craving] also exist?
If the future [fetter of craving] exists, does the present [fetter of craving] also exist?ğŸ”½If the present [fetter of craving] exists, does the future [fetter of craving] also exist?

If the past [fetter of craving] exists, do the future and present [fetters of craving] also exist?ğŸ”½If the future and present [fetters of craving] exist, does the past [fetter of craving] also exist?ğŸ”½If the future [fetter of craving] exists, do the past and present [fetters of craving] also exist?

If the past and present [fetters of craving] exist, does the future [fetter of craving] also exist?ğŸ”½If the present [fetter of craving] exists, do the past and future [fetters of craving] also exist?
If the past and future [fetters of craving] exist, does the present [fetter of craving] also exist?
Up to the fetters of stinginess and jealousy are also like this.
If in a body there is past attachment, is there also past anger?
If there is past anger, is there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, is there also future anger?
If there is future anger, is there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, is there also present anger?
If there is present anger, is there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, is there also past and present anger?
If there is past and present anger, is there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, is there also future and present anger?
If there is future and present anger, is there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, are there also past and future hatred?
If there are past and future hatred, are there also past attachment?
If in a body there is past attachment, are there also past, future and present hatred?
If there are past, future and present hatred, are there also past attachment?

Past attachment, past hatred, past arrogance, future two, present three, past and present four, future and present five, past and future six, past and future and present arrogance seven, up to stinginess and jealousy are also like this.
How many kinds of defilements are included in the view of self?
How many kinds of defilements are included in the view of holding to an extreme, up to the ignorance to be eliminated by the path of cultivation in the formless realm?
Are the three fetters included in the three unwholesome roots, or are the three unwholesome roots included in the three fetters?
Are the three fetters up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions included in the ninety-eight latent afflictions, or are the ninety-eight latent afflictions included in the three fetters?

Up to the nine fetters and ninety-eight latent afflictions, are the nine fetters included in the ninety-eight latent afflictions, or are the ninety-eight latent afflictions included in the nine fetters?
How many of these three fetters are experienced in the desire realm, how many are experienced in the form realm, and how many are experienced in the formless realm?
How many of these up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions are experienced in the desire realm, and how many are experienced in the form and formless realms?
By which concentration is the view of the aggregates exhausted?
By which concentration are the latent afflictions of doubt up to the formless realm exhausted?ğŸ”½If a fetter is past, is that fetter already bound?
If that fetter is already bound, is it a past fetter?
If a fetter is future, is that fetter to be bound?
If a fetter is to be bound, is that fetter future?
If a fetter is presently bound, is that fetter?
If it is presently bound, is that fetter present? (End of the section on the three periods of time of fetters)
If one eliminates the fetters of the desire realm with the path, when one retrogresses from that path, does one obtain the bondage of those fetters or not obtain the bondage of those fetters?

If one eliminates the fetters of the form and formless realms with the path, when one retrogresses from that path, does one obtain the bondage of those fetters or not obtain the bondage of those fetters? (End of the section on retrogressing from the path)
There are nine kinds of knowledge of elimination:
The elimination of the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of suffering and the truth of the cause of suffering in the desire realm is one knowledge of elimination;
The elimination of the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of suffering and the truth of the cause of suffering in the form and formless realms is the second knowledge of elimination;
The elimination of the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm is the third knowledge of elimination;
The elimination of the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the form and formless realms is the fourth knowledge of elimination;
The elimination of the fetters to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm is the fifth knowledge of elimination;
The exhaustion of the fetters eliminated by the path of the form and formless realms is the sixth elimination-knowledge.
The exhaustion of the five lower fetters is the seventh elimination-knowledge.
The exhaustion of desire for form is the eighth elimination-knowledge.
The exhaustion of all fetters is the ninth elimination-knowledge.
Are the nine elimination-knowledges included in all elimination-knowledges, or are all elimination-knowledges included in the nine elimination-knowledges?
There are eight kinds of people:

Those who are progressing towards the stream-enterer, those who have attained the fruit of stream-entry, those who are progressing towards the once-returner, those who have attained the fruit of once-returning, those who are progressing towards the non-returner, those who have attained the fruit of non-returning, those who are progressing towards arhatship, and those who have attained the fruit of arhatship.
One who is progressing towards the stream-enterer and has attained the nine elimination-knowledges, how many knowledges does one possess and how many does one not possess?

Up to one who is progressing towards arhatship and has attained the fruit of arhatship, how many knowledges does one possess and how many does one not possess regarding the nine elimination-knowledges?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.
There are nine fetters:
The fetters of craving, hatred, conceit, ignorance, views, aspiration for gain, doubt, stinginess, and envy.
If there is a fetter of craving in the body, is there also a fetter of hatred?
Answer:
It is so. If there is a fetter of hatred, there is a fetter of craving.
Can there be a fetter of craving without a fetter of hatred?
Answer:
There can be. If the fetter of craving for the form and formless realms has not yet been eliminated.
If there is a fetter of craving in the body, is there also a fetter of conceit?
Answer:
It is so.
If there is a fetter of conceit, is there a fetter of craving?
Answer:
It is so.
If there is a fetter of craving in the body, is there also a fetter of ignorance?
Answer:
It is so. If there is a fetter of craving, there is a fetter of ignorance.
Can there be ignorance without a fetter of craving?ğŸ”½Answer:
There can be.
When the knowledge of suffering arises and the knowledge of the accumulation has not yet arisen, if the ignorance bond that is to be eliminated by the truth of suffering has not yet been eliminated.
If there is a body bound by the attachment bond, is there also the view bond?
Answer:
There may be attachment but no views.
How can there be attachment but no views?
Answer:

When the knowledge of the accumulation has already arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen, if the attachment bond that is to be eliminated by the views associated with the truth of cessation and the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, or if the attachment bond that is to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated.

When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, if the attachment bond that is to be eliminated by the views associated with the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, or if the attachment bond that is to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated.

For one who has attained the truth of the views and is a disciple of the World-Honored One, if the attachment bond that is to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated, this is called attachment but not views.
How can there be views but not attachment?
Answer:

When the knowledge of suffering has already arisen and the knowledge of the cause has not yet arisen, and the view-fetter towards dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering has not yet been eliminated, this is called view but not affection.
What is meant by being bound by both?
Answer:

If the body and limbs are completely bound, or if dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths and contemplation are bound by both.ğŸ”½When the knowledge of suffering has already arisen and the knowledge of the cause has not yet arisen, if dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the cause, the truth of the path, and contemplation are bound by both.

When the knowledge of the cause has already arisen and the knowledge of the cessation has not yet arisen, if dharmas associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of cessation and the truth of the path are bound by both.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen and the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, if dharmas associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of the path are bound by both.
This is called being bound by both in the body.
What is meant by not being bound by both in the body?
Answer:

When the knowledge of the cause has already arisen and the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen, dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering and the truth of the cause are not bound by both.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two are both untied in regard to dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and cessation.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight have the two untied in regard to dharmas eliminated by the four truths.
When desire for the desire realm has already been exhausted, the two are both untied in regard to dharmas of the desire realm.
When desire for the form and formless realms has been exhausted, the two are both untied in regard to dharmas of the form and formless realms.
This is called the two in the body both being untied.
Doubt is also like this.
If there is bondage of the fetter of craving in the body, is there also the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
There may be craving but no stinginess.
How can there be craving but no stinginess?

The answer is:ğŸ”½When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the fetter of craving for dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been exhausted.
When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the fetter of craving for dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been exhausted.

The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight, if the fetter of craving for the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated, this is called having craving but not having aspiration.
What is meant by having aspiration but not having craving?
The answer is:

If the cognition of suffering has arisen but the cognition of the accumulation has not yet arisen, and if the fetter of aspiration for the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, this is called having aspiration but not having craving.
What is meant by being bound by both?
The answer is:
A person whose body and limbs are completely bound is bound by both the four truths and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation.

If the cognition of suffering has arisen but the cognition of the accumulation has not yet arisen, and if the fetter of aspiration for the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, this is called being bound by both.ğŸ”½If the cognition of the accumulation has arisen but the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen, and if the fetter of aspiration for the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, this is called being bound by both.

If the cognition of cessation has arisen but the cognition of the path has not yet arisen, and if the fetter of aspiration for the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path has not yet been eliminated, this is called being bound by both.
This is called being bound by both.
What is meant by being bound by neither?
The answer is:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen and the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the two of the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation are both unattached.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen and the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two of the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion are both unattached.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight, the two of the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths are both unattached.
When desire and love are exhausted, the two of the dharmas of the desire realm are both unattached.
When the desire and love of the form and formless realms are exhausted, the two of the dharmas of the form and formless realms are both unattached.
This is called the two of the body being both unattached.
If the fetter of love exists in the body, does the fetter of stinginess also exist?
Answer:
Thus, if there is stinginess, there is also love.
Can there be love without stinginess?
Answer:

There is, when the fetter of love of the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths of the desire realm has not yet been exhausted, up to when the fetter of love of the dharmas of the form and formless realms has not yet been exhausted.ğŸ”½Jealousy is also like this. The section on love is finished.
The section on pride is also like this.
If there is the fetter of anger in the body, is there also the fetter of pride?
Answer:
Thus, if there is the fetter of anger, there is also the fetter of pride.
Can there be pride without anger?
Answer:
There are the fetters of pride in the form and formless realms that have not yet been eliminated.
If there is the fetter of anger in the body, is there the fetter of ignorance?
Answer:
Thus, if there is anger, there is ignorance.
Can there be ignorance without anger?
Answer:

There is desire that has not yet been eliminated, and the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen. The fetter of ignorance in the desire realm that is eliminated by the truth of suffering and the fetter of ignorance that is eliminated by the truth of accumulation have not yet been eliminated. If the fetters of ignorance in the form and formless realms have not yet been eliminated.
If there is the fetter of anger in the body, is there the fetter of views?
Answer:
There may be anger without views.
What is anger without views?
Answer:

When the desire realm's desires have not yet been eliminated, the cognition of practice has already arisen, but the cognition of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the views that are eliminated by the truth of cessation in the desire realm and the views that are eliminated by the truth of the path are not yet associated with the fetter of ill-will, and the thoughts that are eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm have not yet eliminated the fetter of ill-will.ğŸ”½When the cognition of exhaustion has already arisen, but the cognition of the path has not yet arisen, the views that are eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm and the views that are not yet associated with the fetter of ill-will, and the thoughts that are eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm have not yet eliminated the fetter of ill-will.

Those who have attained insight into the truths and are disciples of the World-Honored One, when the desires of the desire realm have not yet been eliminated, the thoughts that are eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm have not yet eliminated the fetter of ill-will. This is called ill-will without views.
What is meant by views without ill-will?
Answer:

When the desires of the desire realm have not yet been eliminated, the cognition of suffering has already arisen, but the cognition of accumulation has not yet arisen, the views that are eliminated by the truth of suffering in the desire realm and the views that are eliminated by the truth of accumulation have not yet eliminated the fetter of views, and the dharmas of the form and formless realms have not yet eliminated the fetter of views. This is called views without ill-will.
How does one have two in the body?
The answer is:
When the body is completely bound, the four truths and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm are both bound.

When desire has not yet ended, the knowledge of suffering has arisen, but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of accumulation and the truth of the path in the desire realm are both bound.

When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the dharmas associated with the view to be eliminated by the truth of exhaustion and the truth of the path in the desire realm are both bound.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the dharmas associated with the view to be eliminated by the truth of the path in the desire realm are both bound.
This is called having two in the body.
How does one have two not bound in the body?
The answer is:

When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering and the truth of accumulation are both unbound, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are both unbound.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion are both unattached. The two dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are both unattached.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight have the two dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths both unattached.
When desire for the desire realm has already ended, the two dharmas of the desire realm are both unattached.
When desire for the form and formless realms has ended, the two dharmas of the form and formless realms are both unattached.
This is called the two dharmas of the body both being unattached.
Doubt is also like this.
If there is a body bound by the fetter of ill-will, is there also the fetter of envy?
Answer:
There may be ill-will but no envy.
What is having ill-will but no envy?

The answer:ğŸ”½When desire for the desire realm has not yet ended, the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, and the ill-will towards the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet ended.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the ill-will towards the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet ended.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight, who have not yet eliminated desire, have ill-will towards dharmas to be eliminated by the contemplation of the desire realm.
This is called ill-will without loss of aspiration.
How is it that there is loss of aspiration but no ill-will?
Answer:

Before the elimination of desire, when the cognition of suffering has arisen but the cognition of the accumulation has not yet arisen, the loss of aspiration towards dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering in the desire realm that has not yet been eliminated, and the loss of aspiration towards dharmas in the form and formless realms that have not yet been eliminated, this is called loss of aspiration without ill-will.
How is it that both are bound?
Answer:

When the body and limbs of a person are completely bound, both are bound towards dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths and contemplation in the desire realm.ğŸ”½Before the elimination of desire, when the cognition of suffering has arisen but the cognition of the accumulation has not yet arisen, both are bound towards dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the accumulation and the truth of the path in the desire realm.

When the cognition of the accumulation has arisen but the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen, both are bound towards dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of cessation and the truth of the path in the desire realm.
When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, there are two bonds in the desire realm that are both bound.
This is called having two bonds in the body.
What is meant by being liberated from two things in the body?
The answer is:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the two things that are both liberated are the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are also both liberated.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two things that are both liberated are the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are also both liberated.

For the one who has attained the view of the truths and is a disciple of the World-Honored One, the two things that are both liberated are the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are also both liberated.ğŸ”½When desire has already been exhausted, the two things in the desire realm that are both liberated are the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are also both liberated.

When desire for the form and formless realms has been exhausted, the two things in the form and formless realms that are both liberated are the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are also both liberated.
This is called being liberated from two things in the body.
If there is the fetter of ill-will in the body, is there the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
So it is, if there is the fetter of stinginess, there is the fetter of ill-will.
Can there be the fetter of ill-will without stinginess?
Answer:
There is, when the fetter of ill-will of the desire realm that is to be eliminated by the four truths has not yet been eliminated.
The same applies to the fetter of jealousy.
If there is the fetter of ignorance in the body, is there the fetter of views?
Answer:
So it is, if there are views, there is ignorance.
Can there be ignorance without views?

Answer:ğŸ”½When the knowledge of practice has arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the fetter of ignorance of dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of cessation and path that are not associated with views has not yet been eliminated, and the fetter of ignorance of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the fetter of ignorance of dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path that are not associated with views has not yet been eliminated, and the fetter of ignorance of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been eliminated.
For those who have attained the truth of seeing and are disciples of the World-Honored One, the ignorance bond regarding dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been extinguished.
Doubt is also like this.
If there is the bond of ignorance in the body, is there the bond of loss of desire?
Answer:
It is like this, if there is loss of desire, then there is ignorance.
Can there be ignorance without loss of desire?
Answer:

There can be. When the knowledge of practice has arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the ignorance bond regarding dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been extinguished.
When the knowledge of exhaustion has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the ignorance bond regarding dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been extinguished.
For those who have attained the truth of seeing and are disciples of the World-Honored One, the ignorance bond regarding dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation has not yet been extinguished.
If there is the bond of ignorance in the body, is there the bond of stinginess?
Answer:
It is like this, if there is the bond of stinginess, then there is ignorance.
Can there be ignorance without stinginess?
Answer:

Yes, when the ignorance bond regarding dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths of the desire realm is not yet exhausted, and the ignorance bond regarding dharmas of the form and formless realms is not yet exhausted.
The same applies to jealousy. The section on delusion is concluded.
If there is a body bound by the view bond, is there the aspiration bond?
Answer:
Thus, if there is the view bond, there is also the aspiration bond.
Can there be the aspiration bond without the view bond?
Answer:

Yes, when the knowledge of practice has arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, and the aspiration bond regarding dharmas not associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of exhaustion and the truth of the path has not yet been exhausted.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, and the aspiration bond regarding dharmas not associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of the path has not yet been exhausted.
If there is a body bound by the view bond, is there the doubt bond?
Answer:
There may be the view bond without the doubt bond.
How can there be the view bond without the doubt bond?
Answer:

When the knowledge of practice has arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, and the view bond regarding dharmas associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of exhaustion and the truth of the path has not yet been exhausted.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the fetter of view is not yet exhausted regarding the dharmas associated with view that are to be abandoned by the truth of the path.
This is called having view but not doubt.
How is it that one has doubt but not view?
Answer:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the fetter of doubt is not yet exhausted regarding the dharmas associated with doubt that are to be abandoned by the truths of exhaustion and the path.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the fetter of doubt is not yet exhausted regarding the dharmas associated with doubt that are to be abandoned by the truth of the path.
This is called having doubt but not view.
How is it that two things bind the body?
Answer:
When the body is completely bound by the limbs and joints, the two things bind the dharmas to be abandoned by the four truths and contemplation.

When the knowledge of suffering has already arisen but the knowledge of practice has not yet arisen, the two things bind the dharmas to be abandoned by the truths of practice, exhaustion, and the path through contemplation.
This is called the two things binding the body.
How is it that the body is liberated from two things?
Answer:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation are both liberated, the dharmas to be eliminated by the views and doubts not associated with the truth of exhaustion and the truth of the path are both liberated, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation are both liberated.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion are both liberated, the dharmas to be eliminated by the views and doubts not associated with the truth of the path are both liberated, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation are both liberated.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight have the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths both liberated.
When desire and love have already ended, the dharmas of the desire realm are both liberated.
When desire and love for the form and formless realms have ended, the dharmas of the form and formless realms are both liberated.
This is called the two liberations of the body.
If there is a fetter of views binding the body, is there also the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
There may be views but no stinginess.
How can there be views but no stinginess?
Answer:

If the fetter of views regarding the four truths in the desire realm has not yet been eliminated, and the fetter of views regarding the dharmas of the form and formless realms has not yet been eliminated, this is called without stinginess in views.
What is stinginess that is not a view?
Answer:

If desire has not yet been exhausted, the knowledge of practice has already arisen, but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, and the fetter of stinginess regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been eliminated.

If the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, and the fetter of stinginess regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been eliminated.

If one who has attained insight into the truths, a disciple of the World-Honored One, has not yet exhausted desire, and the fetter of stinginess regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been eliminated.
This is called stinginess that is not a view.
What is it to be bound by both in the body?
Answer:
If a person's body and limbs are completely bound, one is bound by both regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.

If desire has not yet been exhausted, the knowledge of suffering has already arisen, but the knowledge of the accumulation has not yet arisen, and one is bound by both regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.
This is called being bound by both.
What is it to be liberated by both?
Answer:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation are both liberated, the dharmas not associated with views to be eliminated by the truths of exhaustion and the path are both liberated, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are both liberated.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion are both liberated, the dharmas not associated with views to be eliminated by the truth of the path are both liberated, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are both liberated.

The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight into the truths, the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths are both liberated, and the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms are both liberated.
When desire for the desire realm has already been exhausted, the dharmas of the desire realm are both liberated.
When desire for the form and formless realms has been exhausted, the dharmas of the form and formless realms are both liberated.
These are called the two liberations.
Jealousy is also like this. The fifth chapter on views is concluded.
If there is the fetter of false speech in the body, is there the fetter of doubt?
Answer:
Thus, if there is the fetter of doubt, there is also the fetter of false speech.
Can there be the fetter of false speech without the fetter of doubt?
Answer:

There can be. When the knowledge of practice has arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of exhaustion and the path are not associated with doubt, and the fetter of false speech has not yet been eliminated.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of the path are not associated with doubt, and the fetter of false speech has not yet been eliminated.
If there is the fetter of false speech in the body, is there the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
There may be the fetter of false speech but not the fetter of stinginess.
What is it like to have the fetter of false speech but not the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:

The fetter of false speech that has not yet been eliminated regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths in the desire realm, and the fetter of false speech that has not yet been eliminated regarding the dharmas in the form and formless realms - this is called having the fetter of false speech but not the fetter of stinginess.
What is it like to have the fetter of stinginess but not the fetter of false speech?
Answer:

When desire has not yet been exhausted, the knowledge of practice has already arisen, but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, and the greed bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been exhausted.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the greed bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been exhausted.

Those who have attained the truth and are disciples of the World-Honored One, when desire has not yet been exhausted, the greed bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet been exhausted.
This is called greed without loss of aspiration.
How are the two bound together?
Answer:
When the body and limbs are completely bound, the two are bound together in the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.

When desire has not yet been exhausted, the knowledge of suffering has already arisen, but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen, the two are bound together in the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.
This is called the two bound together in the body.
How are the two liberated together?
Answer:

When the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the two are liberated together in the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering and accumulation, and the two are liberated together in the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by the truths of suffering, accumulation, and exhaustion. The two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.

The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths, and the two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.
When desire and love have already ended, the two are both liberated from the dharmas of the desire realm.
When desire and love in the form and formless realms have ended, the two are both liberated from the dharmas of the form and formless realms.
This is called both being liberated.
Jealousy is also like this. The sixth gate of lost opportunities, going through the three.
If there is a fetter of doubt in the body, is there also a fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
There may be doubt but no stinginess.
How can there be doubt but no stinginess?
Answer:

The fetter of doubt regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths of the desire realm has not yet ended, and the fetter of doubt regarding the dharmas of the form and formless realms has not yet ended. This is called having doubt but no stinginess.
How can one have stinginess but not doubt?
Answer:

When the desire realm has not yet ended, the knowledge of practice has already arisen, but the knowledge of ending has not yet arisen, and the stinginess bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet ended.

When the knowledge of ending has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, and the stinginess bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet ended.

Those who have attained the truth and are disciples of the World-Honored One, when the desire realm has not yet ended, the stinginess bond of dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm has not yet ended.
This is called having stinginess but not doubt.
How can one be bound by both?
Answer:
When the body and limbs of a person are completely bound, one is bound by both in the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.

When the desire realm has not yet ended, the knowledge of suffering has already arisen, but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen, and one is bound by both in the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the desire realm.
This is called being bound by both.
How can one be liberated from both?
Answer:

When the knowledge of practice has already arisen but the knowledge of exhaustion has not yet arisen, the two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering and the truth of the accumulation. The two are both liberated from the dharmas not associated with doubt to be eliminated by the truth of cessation and the truth of the path. The two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.

When the knowledge of exhaustion has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen, the two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by the truth of suffering, the truth of the accumulation, and the truth of cessation. The two are both liberated from the dharmas not associated with doubt to be eliminated by the truth of the path. The two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.

Those who have attained insight and are disciples of the World-Honored One are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by the four truths. The two are both liberated from the dharmas to be eliminated by contemplation in the form and formless realms.
When desire for the desire realm has already ended, the two are both liberated from the dharmas of the desire realm.
When desire for the form and formless realms has ended, the two are both liberated from the dharmas of the form and formless realms.
These are called the two who are both liberated.
Envy is also like this. The seventh chapter on doubt is concluded.
If in the body there is the fetter of stinginess, is there also the fetter of envy?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is envy, is there also the fetter of stinginess?
Answer:
So it is.
One line is completed, traversing the six destinies.
If in the body there is the fetter of past craving, is there also the future [fetter of craving]?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is the future [fetter of craving], is there also the past [fetter of craving]?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is the past [fetter of craving], is there also the present [fetter of craving]?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it is present.
If there is the present [fetter of craving], is there also the past [fetter of craving]?
Answer:
If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is the future [fetter of craving], is there also the present [fetter of craving]?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it is present.
If there is the present [fetter of craving], is there also the future [fetter of craving]?
Answer:
It is so.
If there is past, is there future and present?
Answer:
The future is bound to the present if it is present.
If there is future and present, is there past?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, it is bound;
if it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen and ended, it is not bound.
If there is future, is there past and present?
Answer:
There may be future without past and present, or there may be future and past without present, or there may be future and present without past, or there may be future and past and present.
How is it that there may be future without past and present?
Answer:
If in a person, the fetter of craving has not yet ended, or if it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen and ended but is not present, this is called future without past and present.
How can there be future and past but not present?
Answer:
If in one's body, attachment has arisen in the past but has not yet been eliminated, and the present attachment to the body is not present, this is called future and past but not present.
How can there be future and present but not past?
Answer:
If in one's body, attachment is present, but has not arisen in the past or has already been eliminated, this is called future and present but not past.
How can there be future and past and present?
Answer:
If in one's body, attachment has arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, and the present attachment to the body is present, this is called future and past and present.
If there is past and present, is there future?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is present, is there past and future?
Answer:ğŸ”½Future is connected to past.
If it has arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, it is connected;
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has already ceased, then it is not bound.
If there is past and future, is there present [attachment]?
Answer:
If it is present, it pervades the six [sense bases].
Hatred, arrogance, stinginess, and jealousy are also like this.
If there is a past bond of ignorance in the body, is there a future [bond]?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is a future [bond], is there a past [bond]?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is a past [bond], is there a present [bond]?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it is present.
If there is a present [bond], is there a past [bond]?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is a future [bond], is there a present [bond]?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it is present.
If there is a present [bond], is there a future [bond]?
Answer:
It is like this.
If there is a past [bond], is there a future or present [bond]?
Answer:
If it is future, it is bound to the present if it is present.
If there is future and present, is there past?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is future, is there past and present?
Answer:
The past is bound to the present if it is present.
If there is past and present, is there future?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is present, is there past and future?
Answer:
So it is.
If there is past and future, is there present?
Answer:
If it is present. Ignorance has been discussed in six ways.
Views, loss of aspiration, and doubt are also like this.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past aversion?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it has arisen and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen, or if it has arisen but has ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past hatred fetter, is there past attachment fetter?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment fetter in the body, is there future hatred fetter?
Answer:
If it has not yet ended.
If there is future hatred fetter, is there past attachment fetter?
Answer:
If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment fetter in the body, is there present hatred fetter?
Answer:
If it is present.
If there is present hatred fetter, is there past attachment fetter?
Answer:ğŸ”½If it has arisen before and not yet ended, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but already ended, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past and present hatred?
Answer:

There may be past attachment but no past or present hatred, or there may be past attachment and past hatred but not present, or there may be past attachment and present hatred but not past, or there may be past attachment and past and present hatred.
What is meant by there being past attachment in the body but no past or present hatred?
Answer:

If attachment arises in the body before and has not yet ended, and also hatred did not arise in this body before, or if it did arise it has already ended and is not presently manifest, this is called being bound by past attachment in the body but not bound by past or present hatred.
What is meant by being bound by past attachment in the body and past hatred but not present?
Answer:

If in the body, the fetter of lust and the fetter of ill-will have previously arisen and not yet ended, and also in this body, the fetter of ill-will is not present, this is called being bound by the past fetter of lust in the body and the past fetter of ill-will, but not having the present [fetter of ill-will].
How is one bound by the past fetter of lust in the body and the present fetter of ill-will, but not the past [fetter of ill-will]?
Answer:

If in the body, the fetter of lust has previously arisen and not yet ended, and also in this body, the fetter of ill-will is present, whether it has not previously arisen or has ended, this is called being bound by the past fetter of lust in the body and the present fetter of ill-will, but not the past [fetter of ill-will].
How is one bound by the past fetter of lust in the body and the past and present fetter of ill-will?
Answer:

If in the body, the fetter of lust and the fetter of ill-will have previously arisen and not yet ended, and also in this body, the fetter of ill-will is present, this is called being bound by the past fetter of lust in the body and the past and present fetter of ill-will.
If there is past and present hatred fetters, are there past love fetters?
Answer:
If the love fetters that arose previously have not yet been eliminated, then they are bound.
If they did not arise previously, or if they arose and were then eliminated, then they are not bound.
If there are past love fetters in the body, are there future and present hatred fetters?
Answer:

There may be past love fetters but neither future nor present hatred fetters, or there may be past love fetters and future hatred fetters but not present, or there may be past love fetters and both future and present hatred fetters.
How does one have past love fetters in the body but neither future nor present hatred fetters?

Answer:ğŸ”½The love fetters that arose previously in the form and formless realms have not yet been eliminated. This is called having past love fetters in the body but neither future nor present hatred fetters.
How does one have past love fetters in the body and future hatred fetters but not present?
Answer:

If the previously arisen attachment in the body has not yet been eliminated, and if the hatred in this body has not yet been eliminated and is not presently manifest, this is called the body being bound by the past attachment and the future hatred, but not being bound by the present hatred.
What is meant by the body being bound by the past attachment and the future and present hatred?
Answer:

If the previously arisen attachment in the body has not yet been eliminated, and if the hatred in this body is presently manifest, this is called the body being bound by the past attachment and the future and present hatred.
If there is future and present hatred, is there past attachment?
Answer:
If it has arisen previously and has not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it has not arisen previously, or if it has arisen and has already been eliminated, then it is not bound.
If there is past attachment in the body, is there past and future hatred?
Answer:

There may be those who are bound by the past attachment but not by the past and future hatred, or those who are bound by the past attachment and future hatred but not by the past, or those who are bound by the past attachment and past and future hatred.
How does one have the past attachment but not the past and future hatred?
Answer:
The past and future attachment of the form and formless realms has not yet been eliminated. This is called having the past attachment but not the past and future hatred.
How does one have the past attachment and future hatred but not the past?
Answer:

The past attachment has not yet been eliminated, and the hatred in this body has not yet been eliminated. If it has not arisen before or has already ceased, this is called having the past attachment and future hatred but not the past.
How does one have the past attachment and past and future hatred?
Answer:

If the fetter of lust and the fetter of ill-will have arisen in the past and have not yet been eliminated, this is called being bound by the past fetter of lust and the past and future fetter of ill-will.
If one has the past and future fetter of ill-will, does one have the past fetter of lust?
Answer:
If it has arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, then one is bound by it.
If it has not arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then one is not bound by it.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
